Case reference: 2017013186.CaseDesc: On March 13, 2017, Cameron Duffy was seen for the last time near the Rainbow Bridge in Niagara Falls, Ontario.

Jacket: Black, Winter, Hood trimmed with fur

Case reference: 2018071052.CaseDesc: On July 11, 1998, the remains of a male individual were discovered on Sulphur Mountain in Banff National Park. There is dental work present, including multiple fillings. The post-mortem interval is estimated to be between 6 months and 5 years.

Case reference: 2014004024.CaseDesc: On December 6, 1989, Ernestine Kasyon was seen for the last time while leaving a residence to use a payphone in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

Case reference: 2012020159.CaseDesc: In July 2004, the remains of an unidentified man were found on the shore of the Fraser River in Richmond, British Columbia. The man had good dental work and had a gold tooth in his left lower jaw. It is estimated that he may have died in 2003 or early 2004.

Case reference: 2014028357.CaseDesc: On September 1, 2014, Meysam Mokri was seen for the last time leaving his family residence in Port Moody, British Columbia with a duffel bag containing some of his clothing. Meysam has not been seen or heard from since.

Shoes: Leather, White, Runners, Air Jordan brand, size 9

Case reference: 2006006199.CaseDesc: Donald Douma has been missing since May 19, 1981. Donald was an avid outdoorsman and he occasionally hitchiked. He was last seen leaving home on a blue CCM bicycle. Donald Douma had expressed interest in moving out West and his family believes that is where he may have gone to.

Teeth: Crooked, Some dental work, upper front tooth has had some white fillings.

Case reference: 2014001413.CaseDesc: Captain Charles David Tillsley, Warrant Officer Tyrus Cobb, Sergeant Major James Mackey and fourth companion departed Fort Churchill for a weekend fishing trip on the Churchill River. They were last seen loading their gear into a boat around 1:00 pm at the Churchill Dock. They were expected back on Sunday September 20th, 1959 but failed to return. The Fort Churchill Military authorities commenced a search with the aid of helicopters and aircraft. On September 21st, the two boats the men used were located, both were swamped and undamaged. Numerous items were found and were identified as belonging to the four men. Extensive land and water searches were conducted.

Case reference: 2018004583.CaseDesc: On December 6, 1953, Marion McDowell was seen for the last time in a parked car in lover’s lane in Scarborough, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, an unknown man opened the car door, and assaulted Marion’s date rendering him unconscious. When he regained consciousness, she was gone.

Chain: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, With a heart

Case reference: 2019065945.CaseDesc: On November 13, 2019, at approximately 7:00 p.m., Shane Kowerko was seen for the last time as he left a friend’s residence in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Shane did not tell his friend where he was going, and left his winter jacket there.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Girl holding baseball bat
Right Side Of Neck, Jiminy Cricket
Right Forearm, Chinese writing 5 characters (woman, word, name)

Case reference: 2014006416.CaseDesc: On January 24, 2014, at approximately 10:15 a.m., Richard Hicks was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014005846.CaseDesc: André Boucher was last seen on July 16, 2012 in Montreal. Mr. Boucher was living in a rooming house and left all his belongings behind. Mr. Boucher was also known as "Popeye"

Case reference: 2016012267.CaseDesc: On February 28, 2016, Lorlene Bone was last seen at a friend’s residence on the Shoal River Indian Reserve in Manitoba. Lorlene is a mother of four and it is out of character for her not to contact her family.

Tattoo: Left Side Of Neck, Three hearts

Case reference: 2017027475.CaseDesc: On May 14, 2017, Roman Mussabekov was seen for the last time when he boarded a flight at the Montreal-Pierre-Elliott-Trudeau International Airport in Montreal, Quebec. He checked-in at a hotel on the island of Antigua in the Caribbean, but did not check-out. Roman contacted his mother a few days after his arrival to tell her that he was going on a hike in the mountains. He has not been seen or heard from since.

Hair: Brown, Short, Straight, Short on the sides, longer on top

Case reference: 2013000062.CaseDesc: Leonard Pinnock has been missing since March 27, 2011. He is originally from Jamaica. He came to visit his family in Montreal and he never made it to the meeting place. He was last seen in the area of Notre-Dame-de Grâce in Montreal, Quebec. He travels between Toronto, Ontario, Montreal and Jamaica.

Case reference: 2008011099.CaseDesc: Michael Hart left the Langton area to look for work in Western Canada as a skilled tradesman. He had maintained contact with his parents by telephone and through his banking. His parents are worried as they have had no contact with him since May 24, 1996.

Case reference: 2009005499.CaseDesc: Joanne Foley was last seen in May of 1989, when she was staying with friends in Port McNicoll, Ontario.  She had mentioned that she was planning on going to western Canada, but there is no indication that she travelled there.  She has had no contact with friends or relatives since May 1989.

Case reference: 2014001970.CaseDesc: On December 20, 1996, Wayne Hansen was seen for the last time as he checked himself out of a hospital in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2016068715.CaseDesc: On July 21, 2013, the body of an adult male was found floating in the Niagara River across from the Youngstown Marina, near the Niagara on the Lake yacht club. Anthropological analysis has suggested that he is black, although there are some features which suggest that he may be mixed Black and Caucasian. He is described as obese however this may be due to post-mortem changes. He is thought to have been in the water for at least one year, and possibly a few years.

Case reference: 2014005036.CaseDesc: Cory Bannerman was seen for the last time when he left work on November 26, 2007, in Edmonton, Alberta. At the time of his disappearance, Cory was despondent.

Case reference: 2014002017.CaseDesc: On September 1, 1997, Marc Dionne was seen for the last time as he was leaving the Harley Pub in the Cap-de-la-Madeleine area of Trois-Rivières, Quebec. He was a passenger in a small white vehicle. Marc was reported missing on the next day and there has been no news from him since.

Case reference: 2014001998.CaseDesc: On July 27, 1985, Maxime Morais accompanied Pierre Beaulieu as they left the City of Montreal, Quebec in Pierre's vehicle, a 1980 orange convertible MG, and traveled to the municipality of Rawdon. They never came back home.

Case reference: 2014005597.CaseDesc: On October 1, 2010, André Benoit was last seen at his home in Sainte-Marguerite-du-Lac-Masson. André may have gone to Montreal in the days preceding his disappearance. The attempts to locate Mr. Benoit have been negative to this date.

Case reference: 2008018099.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1974, at approximately 8:15 hours, Douglas Henderson and Alexander Korecki were canoeing in a 14 foot fiberglass canoe close to the shore in the area of Depot Harbor, Big Sound, in Georgian Bay. The canoe capsized approximately 500 feet away from the campsite.

Case reference: 2014001191.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2010, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Richelieu River in Saint-Mathias-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. In his possession were a Hipstreet brand MP3 player and headphones. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.

Case reference: 2014005152.CaseDesc: Anker Ljunggren was a farm hand who worked in Yellow Grass, SK. Anker was last seen in October, 1935, by his wife. He was working in Craik or Craven, SK but was heading north to find more work and was never seen or heard from again.

Case reference: 2014003708.CaseDesc: John Kane was last seen March 29th, 1994, when he left his residence to go to work at the Saint John Regional Hospital. John never arrived for his shift, which was unusual for him. John was a heavy drinker and gambler. He would become depressed when drinking, and threatened suicide in the past.

Case reference: 2018059144.CaseDesc: On October 9, 2018, Johnathan Braithwaite was seen for the last time as he was leaving the CIBC bank located on 45 King Street, in St. Catharines, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Johnathan was despondent.

Scar: Torso (Front), Scar from two gunshot wounds

Case reference: 2014005182.CaseDesc: On August 1, 2007, at approximately 9:00 am, Richard Anthony Greyeyes was last seen at his residence in Calgary, Alberta.

Scar: Left Hand, On knuckles caused by curling iron

Case reference: 2022001276.CaseDesc: On December 31, 2021, Emily Bailey was seen for the last time in Hamilton, Ontario. Emily is known to live a transient lifestyle, but is also known to remain in constant contact with her friends and family via social media. All of her social media activity has stopped since December 27, 2021.

Backpack: Light Blue, Black, Has black handles

Case reference: 2014002363.CaseDesc: On January 7, 1997, Darcy Puddicomb was seen for the last time. He departed his residence that morning with the intention of attending work. He did not arrive.

Case reference: 2018064370.CaseDesc: On November 8, 2018, at approximately 8:30 am, Artur Mis was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Artur did not show up for work on November 9 and 12th, and has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2014004453.CaseDesc: On January 29, 2004, Samuel Samuelson was seen for the last time while driving a snowmobile by the lake on Bizard Island toward Deux Montagnes in Montreal, Quebec. The ice collapsed and Samuel and his snowmobile fell into the water.

Jewelry: Gold, Chain with razor blade pendant
Gold, Bracelet worn on right wrist

Case reference: 2014004887.CaseDesc: On October 10, 2005, Ghassem Sabeiri Gilchalan was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014003956.CaseDesc: Mary Louise Lejeune was last seen on February 23, 1991 in Montreal, Quebec. She left without notifying her family and she has not been heard from since.

Coat: Wool, Grey, Purple collar and wrists

Case reference: 2014001859.CaseDesc: On August 19, 1997, Wendy Ratte was reported missing by her daughter. Mrs. Ratte was last seen on August 18, at 3pm. Her vehicle was found, locked, in a grocery store parking lot. Investigations led to a conviction in 2010, however her remains have yet to be located.

Case reference: 2014005385.CaseDesc: The Calgary Police Service is seeking the public's assistance in locating Laura Lee Murray. She was last seen in downtown Calgary, Alberta, on June 25, 1992.

Case reference: 2012020041.CaseDesc: Carolyn Pruyser was last seen at a Mohawk service station in Peace River shortly after midnight on May 17, 1984.  Her car was found abandoned a short distance from her parents home with keys and purse still in the car.

Blouse: Yellow, Orange, Short Sleeve "V" Neck Blouse

Case reference: 2014003539.CaseDesc: On August 27, 2001, Jeffery McArthur was seen for the last time in Edmonton, Alberta. It is important to note that Jeffery suffers from a medical condition that affects his coordination, and balance. During the time of his disappearance, he may have been driving a 1993 white Mercury Topaz. The vehicle was subsequently located on September 2, 2001, in the west parking lot of Rundle Park in Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2012020090.CaseDesc: In 1993, a human foot and running shoe were located along the North Saskatchewan River near Prince Albert, SK, approximately 1 km west of the river forks. The foot was examined by the University of Saskatchewan Department of Archaeology. It was determined to be that of a robust male, size 10, big boned, and athletic, likely between the ages of 30 and 60.

Case reference: 2023012025.CaseDesc: On March 6th, 2023 shortly after 12:00 pm, Kimberly Jackson was last seen in the area of Prospect Point, American Falls, in Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of her disappearance Kimberly was despondent.

Tattoo: Right Upper Arm, Samurai skull with a knife

Case reference: 2006013599.CaseDesc: Donald Taylor has been missing from South Porcupine, Ontario since August 24, 1989 at 7:00 in the morning and has not been seen since.

Boots: Leather, Tan, "Kodiak" Steel toe work boots

Case reference: 2014005399.CaseDesc: Jason Picken was reported missing to police in May 2008 in Cowansville, Quebec. Jason has not been seen or heard from by his entourage since March 24th, 2008. Following subsequent investigations, investigators believe Jason may have been the victim of foul play.

Scar: Eyes, Scar on the right eye

Case reference: 2012020055.CaseDesc:
The body of an Asian male was discovered by cleaning staff at the Northbrook Inn in Grand Rapids, Manitoba.  The individual had checked in at 15:30h after arriving on the bus from Winnipeg.  At 18:00h cleaning staff entered the room to find the occupant deceased in a chair.
It was learned that the subject checked into the hotel under the name "CHERON, Deoung".  A small black bag containing herbal medication was located in the room, which after translation from Korean revealed the prescription was issued to "PARK, Seng Dae"(variation of spelling PARK, Sang Dae).  It should be noted that the bus ticket-stub was located with the deceased identified "DUNG" as the individual who purchased the ticket.
Numerous checks were made with variety of agencies in an attempt to determine the man's identity.  It is believed he may be of Korean or Chinese decent.

Case reference: 1996004360.CaseDesc: Nina Akbarian may be in the company of her father, Naser Akbarian.

Case reference: 2014005735.CaseDesc: On December 24, 1998, Rostyslav Korolko was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. At the time of his disappearance, Rostyslav was living with his brother and he had told him that he was going to look for work.

Case reference: 2014003376.CaseDesc: Paula Wade was last seen leaving a hospital in St. Catharines, Ontario on November 25th, 1979. The next day, her abandoned vehicle was located in a parking lot in Niagara Falls, Ontario. At the time of her disappearance, Paula was despondent

Coat: Dark Blue, Orange, Ankle length navy coat with orange hood
Jewelry: Gold, Gold, Ring, With red birth stone
Scar: Abdomen, Large scar up to breasts

Case reference: 2014005164.CaseDesc: Anne Peters was reported missing in October 2008 after she had not been heard from for a month. Anne was a street trade worker and had a drug dependency.

Case reference: 2020007336.CaseDesc: On December 16, 1970, Abraham Wolfson was seen for the last time leaving a law office in Toronto, Ontario. Abraham had left with certificates worth $50,000 and had come into the city to arrange the sale of a property. Despite the offer of a reward from Abraham’s family, there has been no information pertaining to his whereabouts.

Case reference: 2014005577.CaseDesc: Ganiyu Adedeji Onabule was reported missing in Edmonton in June of 1975. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2020008393.CaseDesc: On November 2, 1982, David Black was seen for the last time by his friend in Toronto, Ontario. David is a chronic cancer patient.

Case reference: 2024015700.CaseDesc: Guy Pyke left his residence in Syracuse, NY, at approximately 3pm on April 2,1999, in a 1989 dark blue Chevy Blazer with NY plate FMS 867. Shortly after Guy was seen in the vicinity of the 2000 block of State Route 11 in the Evan Mills, NY area. Guy has family in Brockville, Ontario, and mentioned wanting to visit them however due to the state of his dementia it is believed he could’ve become lost in his travels.

Case reference: 2014003430.CaseDesc: Alim Hasan was last seen by his mother in Burnaby on March 21, 1990, when he was returning to his residence in Edmonton via Grey Hound Bus. Alim had a history of mental illness. On April 6, 1990, an unknown person left one of Alim’s luggage at the front door of Hope RCMP Detachment.

Luggage: Synthetic, Red, White, Sports Bag, Red Sports bag with white trim

Case reference: 2006020599.CaseDesc: Simon Angeconeb was last seen on July 10, 1993 at Cat Island Lodge located on Red Lake in the District of Kenora, Ontario. He was heading to his cabin to go to sleep and has not been seen since. Mr. Angeconeb may have been suffering from a concussion.

Case reference: 2012020653.CaseDesc: On May 12, 2003, Patsy Haysom was last seen when she was dropped off at the back of her residence by a friend.

Shoes: Red, Blue, BUM Equipment Logo, Slip on

Case reference: 2016012810.CaseDesc: On March 12th, 2016 shortly after midnight, Denny Poole and a friend left Dawson Creek with the intent of heading to Fort St John. It is unknown if they intended to walk, hitchhike, or had other means to get there. The duo became disoriented and ended up wandering the highway and back roads for over 20 hours. It was learned that neither of them was prepared to be out for this period of time. At some point, Denny and his friend had a difference of opinion on whether they should continue on their journey or not, and the two ended up separating. The last confirmed sighting of Denny was just south of the Kiskatinaw Bridge on Highway 97. Denny has some disabilities and it is recommended that he be under adult supervision.

Shoes: Black, Purple, green and white "Osiris" brand
Sweater: Grey, Dark grey hoodie with red "DGK" symbol

Case reference: 2016061231.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1968, an unidentified male was found hanging in a hotel room. He had checked in under the name Henry Drendorf. No identification was found. This individual was found with several bags of architectural books.

Case reference: 2006007099.CaseDesc: On July 21, 1995, Erwyn Lippett and his friend, Kirk Weidmann, left the Brucedale conservation area to go for a canoe ride on Lake Huron, near Port Elgin, Ontario. Two life-jackets and two paddles were recovered in the water. Neither man has been seen since.

Mark: Forehead, Large mole on forehead at receding hairline

Tattoo: Right Arm, Boot Hill with cross
Chest, clouds with name Simon and Victoria

Case reference: 2014005006.CaseDesc: On September 10, 2007, Sun Jin, her husband Joon Han, and their daughter Il Han were seen for the last time at a school in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2023007749.CaseDesc: Renee Severson was last seen on January 26, 2023 at 10:54 AM near the brink of the American Falls, Niagara Falls, New York. At the time of her disappearance Renee was despondent.

Boots: Other, Dark colour shoes or boots
Coat: Red, WINTER, With a fur hood

Case reference: 2006017099.CaseDesc: Joan Dorothy Lawrence last resided on North Lancelot Road, Huntsville.

Case reference: 2014002751.CaseDesc: Rebecca Guno was last seen in June of 1983 by her common law husband. Miss Guno was taking a bus downtown with an unknown female friend, but did not arrive at her intended destination.

Case reference: 2014004993.CaseDesc: On the 5th of July, 2002, Percy McKenzie was last seen near Powell Island on Lac La Ronge lake, La Ronge, Saskatchewan. Percy was alone and the lake was very rough at the time. Searches failed to locate him.

Case reference: 2006013999.CaseDesc: Walter Glynn was last seen July 23, 1980 walking southbound on Main Street, Kirkland Lake.  Mr. Glynn was heading to the A&P grocery store at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014001540.CaseDesc: Marie Laliberté was a resident of east Vancouver who was engaged in a high risk lifestyle. She was last seen by her resource worker on January 1, 1997. Due to her increasingly sporadic contact with family and a lack of social interaction with others, she was not reported missing until March 8, 2002.

Case reference: 2014002866.CaseDesc: On August 29, 1989, at approximately 2:40 p.m., Jason Boulton slipped and fell into the water near 12 Mile Creek at the north east corner of the Generating Station in Port Dalhousie Harbour, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016068414.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1965, this unidentified male was found on the shore of Lake Ontario just east of the harbour pier in Oshawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he was not circumcised.

Teeth: Decayed teeth; gold inlay and prosthesis in his upper dentition; lower dentition had an amalgam filling
Shoes: Leather, Veritough, one left shoe; size 7
Scar: Right Upper Arm, circular puckered scar 1" in diameter on the anterior right underarm
Tattoo: Right Forearm, blue tattoo of a woman's face

Case reference: 2019033665.CaseDesc: On July 18, 1988, the remains of a male were found in a field on the side of road 132 in Tracy, Québec. A camp was found near the remains.

Case reference: 2014005083.CaseDesc: Alexander Belcourt was reported missing by his family in November 1995. He has not been seen or heard from since September 1991. During the time of his disappearance, Alexander was known to live in the inner core of Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2006008299.CaseDesc: Richard Rollo jumped out of his boat into Muskrat Lake, near Gull Rock, Cobden, Ontario in 1997 and never resurfaced.  He is presumed drowned.

Case reference: 2014002814.CaseDesc: On December 17, 1983, Guy Turgeon was seen for the last time when he left his home in the Rosemont-La-Petite-Patrie District in Montreal, Quebec. He was despondent and suffered from mental health issues. Guy hasn’t been seen or heard from him since.

Case reference: 2014003667.CaseDesc: On May 23, 1996, at approximately 7:30 p.m., Kevin Lotysz was seen for the last time as he left the McKellar Hospital in Thunder Bay, Ontario. Kevin is an avid drummer and enjoys music.

Mark: Cheek, Birthmark on lower right cheek
Tattoo: Chest, Sword on left side of chest

Case reference: 2006007899.CaseDesc: Edward Michael Krantz was last seen on August 23, 1975. He paddled alone into Lake Huron to go fishing, in a 17 foot aluminium MICHI Craft canoe, serial MCC11799M74JF7. Mr. Krantz and the canoe have never been located.

Pants: Orange, Red, white and blue striped pants
Socks: White, Knee high, yellow top stripe
Scar: Lower Back, 25 inch vertical scar from surgery

Case reference: 2018063238.CaseDesc: On January 20, 2001, Edward Pinarreto was seen for the last time when he left Toronto, Ontario, for a two-week vacation in Cuba. Edward was scheduled to return to Toronto on February 3, but never board his flight.

Case reference: 2014005209.CaseDesc: On June 30, 1990, at approximately 10:15am, Cindy Clair was seen for the last time near 25 Martha Eaton Way in Toronto, Ontario. Ms. Clair told her roommate she was going for a walk and never returned.

Case reference: 2014003573.CaseDesc: On October 11, 1978, George Greyeyes left from Petersfield, Manitoba on a hunting trip. He left by canoe and was supposed to return that same day. Water conditions were poor with high winds and waves. On October 12, 1978, he had not yet returned and was reported missing to police. Searches were conducted and he was never located. George is presumed dead due to drowning.

Jacket: Nylon, Brown, Quilted plaid jacket with elbow patches

Case reference: 2017070398.CaseDesc: Randy Whitcher was seen for the last time on November 29, 2017 at approximately 10 a.m. in the 11000 Block of the Westminster Highway in Richmond, British Columbia.

Case reference: 2008006899.CaseDesc: On November 2, 1966, Mr. Wynacht and two of his friends went hunting North of Sudbury along hydro pole lines, 20 miles north of Gauthiers corners on hwy 69, Kitchener Township. As a snow storm picked up, the hunters got separated along the pole lines, and Mr. Wynacht vanished. On the morning of Saturday November 5, 1966, a police cruiser led the search of the area with 35 citizens and two aircrafts. The search was completed on November 15, 1966, with negative results and no clue as to his disappearance had been uncovered.

Shirt: Wool, Red, Black, Checkered heavy doe skin

Case reference: 2015056222.CaseDesc: On October 15, 2015, Robert Luery was last seen on Lake Simcoe where he was sailing in strong winds.  His sail boat was located floating around the lake unoccupied.  An extensive search of the lake was completed and Robert was not located.

Case reference: 2014004857.CaseDesc: On September 21, 1992, David Neufeld, Peter Bentzen and Kenneth Vaughan were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. The three men had been associating with each other as “runners” in order to smuggle cigarettes into Canada from the United States by means of a boat. David’s vehicle and boat trailer were located at Ashbridges Bay, Toronto. The aging boat that was borrowed from a friend has never been recovered and the three men have not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014006349.CaseDesc: Jonathan Riley left his residence on April 26, 2013, indicating he was going to Toronto for a few days. His mode of transportation is unknown as he did not have access to a vehicle.  His family and friends have not heard from him since May 2013.  He is a self-employed computer technician.

Scar: Torso (Front), Possibly has surgical scar on one shoulder

Case reference: 2000000830.CaseDesc: Charlene was last seen hitch-hiking at the intersection of Hwy 3 and the Rae Access Road.

Case reference: 2014003880.CaseDesc: Yvon Robitaille was last seen on the evening of April 1, 1996, as he was travelling on 3rd Avenue in Val-d'Or. He has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2016067449.CaseDesc: Jennifer Hillier-Penney was last seen in St. Anthony, NL on November 30, 2016.  It is believed that she went missing around 8:00 pm that evening from a residence in that community. Her personal belongings, including her cell phone, purse, shoes and jacket were left behind.

Scar: on knee from surgery, unsure which knee
Tattoo: Capricorn sign on wrist, unsure of which wrist
Right Chest, eye of horus on the right rib

Case reference: 2014005187.CaseDesc: In the afternoon of December 29, 1960, Helga Kaserer was seen for the last time in the area of Harvard Avenue and Roncesvalles Avenue in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001603.CaseDesc: On February 2, 1992, Richard Liboiron was seen for the last time as he left a hotel in Gatineau, Quebec. Mr. Liboiron and a friend departed from the hotel on a snowmobile heading in the direction towards Ottawa. The two crossed the Ottawa River and did not make it to the shore.

Case reference: 2021008285.CaseDesc: Trenton Phillips was last seen by a family member at their residence in Red Deer, Alberta in the summer of 2017.  Trenton told the family member he was going to Kenya in Africa with Lifewater to build wells.

Case reference: 2005002599.CaseDesc: On October 21, 1989, an unidentified man was discovered in the area of County Road 14 in Napanee, Ontario.  Biogeographic ancestry testing predicts that this man was of south Asian ancestry.

Shirt: White, DRESS, Brand: Pierre Cardin; grey, blue, and red thin stripes

Case reference: 2014005999.CaseDesc: On February 5, 2013, at approximately 3:00 p.m., Quincy Blackburn was seen for the last time when his sister dropped him off at the Toronto Pearson International Airport in Toronto, Ontario. Quincy boarded a flight to Trinidad and was scheduled to return on February 19, but did not board the flight.

Jewelry: Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Earrings, Square diamond earrings
Pants: Red, White, TRACK, Track pants; Brand: Adidas

Case reference: 2014005435.CaseDesc: Although it is unconfirmed, acquaintances of Douglas Scott Renz indicate that he may have left the Chilliwack area in early 2009.  Mr. Renz last had contact with friends in the Chilliwack area in February of 2010, they reported him missing that April.

Case reference: 2014006318.CaseDesc: On November 18, 2013, it is believed that Stewart Ward travelled from Brampton to Niagara Falls, Ontario.  Stewart's vehicle was later located in a parking lot near the Falls.  Stewart has not been seen or heard from.

Case reference: 2013000047.CaseDesc: On August 11, 2000, Gianfranco Ferrara was seen for the last time in Montreal, Quebec. He had an appointment in the east end of Montreal but he never showed up.

Case reference: 2024015325.CaseDesc: Robert O’Toole was last seen on March 19,2024, in Central Hamilton, Ontario.  Family and colleagues have concerns regarding Robert’s health, noting a significant decline since their last interaction.

Scar: Genitals, Surgical removal of the left testicle
Abdomen, Over the belly button from a feeding tube.

Case reference: 2014003985.CaseDesc: On November 28, 1974 Randall Crighton was seen for the last time in Richmond, British Columbia. He was involved in a motor vehicle accident with a friend who had left the scene. Randall has not been seen or heard from since. Randall had substance abuse problems and may have been despondent at the time of his disappearance.

Case reference: 2013000087.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1993, Alan Curtis was seen for the last time during a visit to his uncle’s home in Montreal, Quebec. He was to take a flight from Mirabel airport to go home to British Columbia. He never arrived at his destination.

Luggage: Blue, Metal box and a tent

Case reference: 2014005358.CaseDesc: On September 26, 2007, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Ana Jimenez was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. That day, Ana’s daughter found that her mother and all of her personal belongings were gone. Ana had been visiting from Columbia and was due to return on September 27, but never boarded her flight.

Case reference: 2014004814.CaseDesc: Stephanie Stewart was employed as a Fire Spotter at the Athabasca Lookout near Hinton, Alberta when she disappeared on August 26, 2006. She was 70 years old at the time of her disappearance. Stephanie led an active lifestyle and was in good health. Her disappearance is being treated as suspicious. The police investigation is ongoing.

Case reference: 2014005193.CaseDesc: Margaret Schwabe was last seen at her home in East St. Paul, Manitoba. She has not been seen since.

Hair: Grey, Wavy, Short, Hair was dyed dark brown with a red undertone
Teeth: Full upper dentures and a partial dental plate on lower jaw

Case reference: 2020008361.CaseDesc: On May 12, 1991, at approximately 4:00pm, Ian Dickson was last seen leaving a restaurant near Yonge Street and Eglington Avenue in Toronto, Ontario. Ian was visiting from Scotland, and was due to return on May 23, but he did not board his flight.
